etymology.description: 淮(淮) (huái, "Huai River"), 海(海) (hǎi, "sea"), 战(戰) (zhàn, "war; battle"), 役(役) (yì, "campaign; battle")
etymology.interpretation: The 淮海(淮海) (Huáihǎi, "Huai and sea") refers to the geographical area between the Huai River and the sea. 战役(戰役) (zhànyì, "battle; campaign") signifies a military campaign. The word 淮海战役(淮海戰役) (Huáihǎi zhànyì) refers specifically to the historical military campaign during the Chinese Civil War, fought in the region around the Huai River.

parts.english: Huai and sea; region between Huai River and the sea

examples.chinese: 淮海战役震撼历史(淮海戰役震撼歷史)。
许多人纪念淮海战役(許多人紀念淮海戰役)，铭记那段历史(銘記那段歷史)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō rén jìniàn Huáihǎi zhànyì, míngjì nà duàn lìshǐ.
examples.english: Many people commemorate the Huaihai Campaign, remembering that period of history.
